Morning Habits.description: Do a few simple stretches or yoga poses to release tension and boost circulation. Example: Cat-Cow stretch, Downward Dog, or Sun Salutations.
Practice deep breathing or mindfulness meditation to center yourself for the day ahead. Example: Box breathing (inhale 4 seconds, hold 4 seconds, exhale 4 seconds).
Rehydrate after a nightâ€™s rest to kick-start your metabolism and brain function. Consider adding lemon or ginger to aid digestion.
Start the day with positive self-talk or gratitude journaling. Example: 'I am capable and strong.'
Opt for a balanced meal that includes protein, fiber, and healthy fats. Example: Oatmeal, whole grain toast with avocado, or a smoothie with greens.

Mid-Day Habits.description: Every 1-2 hours, take a 5-10 minute break to stand up, stretch, or take a short walk.
Eat slowly and savor every bite, focusing on your meal. Avoid multitasking during meals.
Drink water throughout the day to keep your body functioning optimally and reduce stress.
Reflect on three things you are grateful for in the middle of the day.
Take a short 10-20 minute nap to recharge your energy and improve mood.

Evening Habits.description: Engage in some form of exercise (walk, jog, yoga, dance, etc.). Exercise releases endorphins which act as natural stress relievers.
Write down your thoughts, stressors, or successes of the day to reflect on what went well.
Avoid screens (phones, computers, etc.) at least an hour before bed to improve sleep quality.
Slow your body down for sleep with deep breathing or guided relaxation. Example: 4-7-8 breathing technique.
Set a to-do list or a plan for tomorrow to ease your mind and reduce anxiety before sleep.

Night Habits.description: Reflect on three things you're grateful for before bed to shift your mindset positively.
A warm bath with Epsom salts or a relaxing shower can reduce muscle tension and promote relaxation.
Drink caffeine-free herbal teas like chamomile, peppermint, or lavender to calm the mind before sleep.
Gently tense and relax each muscle group in your body to reduce physical tension.
Ensure your bedroom is cool, dark, and quiet to create a restful sleep environment.

General Habits.habit: Focus on One Task at a Time
General Habits.description: Avoid multitasking to reduce stress and improve productivity.
Declutter your workspace or living area to reduce mental stress.
Watch a funny video, talk to a friend, or engage in something that brings joy to lighten the mood.
